channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Melania Trump threatens to sue Hunter Biden over ‘extremely salacious’ Jeffrey Epstein comments
item.description: The president and first lady have long said they were introduced by Paolo Zampolli, a modeling agent, at a New York Fashion Week party in 1998.

item.title: Man Charged With Assaulting Federal Agent With Sandwich in D.C.
item.description: A video showed a man repeatedly calling a group of officers “fascists” before throwing a sub sandwich at one.

item.title: Trump-Putin Meeting: Where, What Time and What’s at Stake
item.description: The American leader has agreed to a meeting with the Russian president in Alaska on Friday to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Taylor Swift Found a New Way to Control Her Narrative: Podcasts
item.description: For stars promoting their projects, podcasts have become an appealing alternative to late-night TV and glossy magazines.

item.title: FBI returns priceless stolen Hernan Cortes manuscript to Mexico
item.description: Mexico requested the help of the FBI’s Art Crime Team last year and the FBI eventually narrowed the search to the U.S., though the agency didn't say w...

item.title: Does Earning $142,000 in New York City Make You Rich?
item.description: Andrew Cuomo is basing his new line of attack against Zohran Mamdani on a certain definition of wealth. But the reality is complicated.

item.title: The next era of crypto
item.description: Crypto is going mainstream—what the next 5 years will look like.

item.title: Big Tech’s A.I. Boom Is Reordering the U.S. Power Grid
item.description: Electricity rates for individuals and small businesses could rise sharply as Amazon, Google, Microsoft and other technology companies build data cente...

item.title: From friendly to frenemies: Retracing the Trump-Putin relationship as they meet in Alaska
item.description: Trump has long boasted that he’s gotten along well with Putin, even praising him as “pretty smart” for invading Ukraine. But now he wants a cease-fire...

item.title: Harvard researcher unearths data airlines don’t want you to notice: Three-hour flight delays are 4x more common now than 30 years ago
item.description: “It’s kind of a pessimistic story,” Maxwell Tabarrok said.

item.title: What to Know About the Heat Wave in Southern Europe
item.description: Firefighters have spent days battling blazes in Greece, Portugal, Spain and elsewhere. Forecasters said temperatures could pass 111 degrees in some pl...

item.title: How a Call From Trump Ignited a Frantic Week of Diplomacy by Ukraine
item.description: Once a vague proposal for a territorial swap gained clarity, a worried President Volodymyr Zelensky worked to rally allies before Friday’s Trump-Putin...

item.title: How China Went From Clean Energy Copycat to Global Innovator
item.description: A surge in high quality research and patent applications has cemented China’s dominance in the industry.

item.title: Tourist ‘Is in Trouble’ After Stones Taken From Pompeii, Police Say
item.description: A Scottish man is under investigation for aggravated theft, police officials said, after visiting the ancient Italian site.

item.title: Sudan Hit by Its ‘Worst Cholera Outbreak’ in Years, Medical Charity Says
